title: Slope of a graphed line
prompt: What is the slope of the line?
hint: The slope between two points is the ratio <math> <mrow>  <mfrac linethickness="1">   <mrow><mn>RISE</mn>   </mrow>   <mrow><mn>RUN</mn>   </mrow>  </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.
feedback: To find the slope of a line, pick two points on the line. Subtract the y’s of the two points, and subtract the x’s of the two points. Then divide the difference between the y’s by the difference between the x’s. If the line slopes up to the right, the slope is positive. If the line slopes up to the left, the slope is negative. The slope of this line is 3 divided by 1, which is 3.
